parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
Wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence. From sophos; wisdom.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From ek and agorazo; to buy up, i.e. Ransom; figuratively, to rescue from loss.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.
